location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 40 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government that Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, the Imam of Muscat, is at war with the people of Hizim. It reports on a recent failed attempt by the Imam to take their fort, and the Resident's apprehensions that the Jawassmees [Qawāsim] may get involved, which could affect the Imam's attitude towards the Beneboo Ali tribe [Banī Bū ‘Alī].
